Comments: selva also exists in Spanish
Note that English also has arms which is a cognate
Note extra meaning of costume in Portuguese which doesn't exist in Spanish or English
but oficina also exists in SP
The dance meaning is the same in all three languages
There is also disk, which shares the other meanings of disco in Spanish and Portuguese
In Portuguese and LatAm Spanish, it can also mean advertising
(sugestión also exists in Spanish and means the same)
False cognate in portuguese: violão
jugo is a false cognate in portuguese/spanish too
vial can also be a road or something referring to roads in Spanish (administración vial)
both 'computadora' and ordenador are possible as translation into Spanish
competición in Spanish refers to an event
but it is a true cognate in the sense of assume a role/office
pull in spanish is a sweater
but there are also true cognates colarinho and coleira in PT
spanish amasar can also be a true cognate
But letter in the sense of letter of the alphabet is a true cognate
aderezo may be more common in SP
It's a true cognate in the football cup sense
